instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.TPS51125: What is TPS51125? This is a power chip responsible for the PP3V3_S5,  PP5V_S5,  and PP5V_S3 power rails on many A1278 model Macbooks.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPBUSS_G3H: What is PPBUSS_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PPBUSS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPV3V42_G3H: What is PPV3V42_G3H? This is a typo of PP3V42_G3H When you see PPV3V42_G3H, assume they meant to type PP3V42_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message:
Hi I recieved this board it had a few issues I replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and <CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP> And a few resistors. Now I have 

<SIGNAL>PPBUSS_G3H</SIGNAL> =12.5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>=5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> =3.42v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> =3.42v 

<CHIP>U5010</CHIP>
PIN 1 <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_SMC_CLK_F</SIGNAL> =3.42v
PIN 7 <SIGNAL>SMC_CLK_R</SIGNAL> =1.49v ??
Pin 12 <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_SMC_CLK_F</SIGNAL> = 3.42v

The logic board will turn on with battery by shorting power on pads but not with charger. Also when it powers on no cpu activity with mouse or usb. <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> PIN 1 of <CAPACITOR>C1652</CAPACITOR> =.878v
And CPU gets warm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message:
Are the mentioned voltages for charger only, no battery?

Be aware, this board only starts with 85W charger, if no battery present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message:
The voltages are without battery present. 
 I added a few other measurements on the first post 

<CHIP>U5010</CHIP>

PIN 7 <SIGNAL>SMC_CLK_R</SIGNAL> =1.49v ??
Pin 12 <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_SMC_CLK_F</SIGNAL> = 3.42v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message:
Why do insist with DC voltage on a crystal???
If you really want to check it, measure frequency, or check waveform with o-scope.
However, 1.49V points to oscillation is present.

Did you check the power charger reported by an working machine?
Do you still have dim Magsafe light?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message:
Yes it works on other machines
And yes it works on other machines
I will check with oscilloscope today

threads.message:
I said to check the charger power reported by system.
Do not assume is 85W without confirm that...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message:
Try to start in SMC bypass mode, with charger only.

Did you check if battery is charging?
Do you get voltage on all big coils?
Do you note VCORE droping from 1.1V to 0.85V after few seconds?

The coils near heatsink 0v

12.55 Coil near fuse
5v Near pch
3.3v near usb

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>=0

You cannot expect board booting in this case.

It doesn’t appear to be charging 
J695”

Pin 6 is 3.42  <SIGNAL>SMCBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message:
VCORE change looks like board tries to boot.
At least PCH read BIOS and adjust the voltage.

GPU voltages appear too?
Did you change <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>?

BTW, I suppose you meant 0.859 instead of 8.59...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message:
Yes I meant .859v 
replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> that was the first thing I changed after tps and <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>
On L8920 =.985v <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU_REG_R</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message:
Let the board on with battery alone for 15-30 min; then check again if charging.
11.22V is almost full charge.

Did you use hot air to replace <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>?
Is not a good idea at all; heat can affect other things.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message:
No I used hot tweezers 

Also, I just checked <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>  and something just started pulling down my <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> line.  I had solid s3/s5 lines I’m sure of it. Now it’s .731v :( 
I will get s3 lines up again and let you know if it charges

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light
threads.message: ok so what I’ve found with battery disconnected I have to hold the power pads down for 2-3 seconds and the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> line comes up to 3.3v with out battery. I don’t have <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>  When this happens and I mean nothing not even trying to start. Shouldn’t this board power on when a mage safe is connected ?

In fact it does, if <SIGNAL>3V3_S3</SIGNAL> appears; check other S3 voltages presence.
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> goes high at same time?

Ok it is indeed charging the battery I discharged the battery on the board with no battery it went down to 10v then I plugged in the charger left it a while and it went up to 11.10v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> lines all exhibit .749v when no battery is present

With battery present on all these measurements below. without battery all these signals are low .7v or zero:

I replaced <CHIP>U5380</CHIP> 0v on pin 6 since I wasn’t getting <SIGNAL>CPUVCORE_HISIDE_IOUT</SIGNAL> Which makes <SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_HI_ISENSE</SIGNAL> Now it 3.3v
But still nothing same

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is also 3.3v
